column4: hey everyone, I just installed gtk-gnutella, but when i connect it says I am firewalled both tcp and udp wise.  I dont have firestarter or anything installed and am on my own wireless network.  does anyone know how to fix this?

hey everyone, I just installed gtk-gnutella, but when i connect it says I am firewalled both tcp and udp wise.  I dont have firestarter or anything installed and am on my own wireless network.  does anyone know how to fix this?
you're behind a router that does PAT, more than likely, and which in effect performs as a firewall
the router will probably call it NAT (but it's actually not)
do you know how i can fix that?
log into your router and setup port-forwarding appropriately
you probably need to allow for it in iptables then
let me look for a link for ya
still looking
what ports are you using for gnutella?
you there?
icant get this to work.  i dont know what im doing wrong
i set the port as open in firestarter but it keeps telling me that Im firewalled both TCP wise and UDP wise
at this point im plugged directly into my modem
did you use the wiki i gave you?
i checked it out, i used the last pat of it, where it says turn the whole firewall off
iptables -F
and no luck?
that didn't work
i don't know what to say then man
thanks for trying man, i'll keep looking into it
